contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox surname | name = Xing | image = 邢姓 - 楷体.svg | image_size = | caption = Xing surname in [[regular script]] | pronunciation = Xíng <small>(Pinyin)</small><br/>Hêng <small>([[Pe̍h-ōe-jī]])</small> | language = Chinese, Vietnamese, Korean | languageorigin = [[Old Chinese]] | origin = | derivation = | meaning = | variant = Xing, Hsing <small>(Mandarin)</small><br/>Heng <small>([[Hokkien]])</small><br/>Hình <small>(Vietnamese)</small><br/><!--- <small>(Cantonese)</small><br/> <small>(Taishanese)</small><br/> <small>(Gan)</small><br/> <small>(Korean)</small>---> | cognate = | derivative = | seealso = | family = }} '''Xing''' (Chinese: [[wikt:邢|邢]]) denotes a [[Chinese surname]]. There are two hypothesized sources for the extant catalogue of surnames: 1. According to [[Yuanhe Xing Zhuan]] ([[:zh:元和姓纂]]), or Yuanhe Xing Collections, Xing is originated from [[Ji (surname)|Ji]] ([[:zh:姬|姬]]), the royal family of [[Zhou Dynasty]] in China. The fourth son of the [[Duke of Zhou]], was appointed the ruler of the State of Xing (now [[Xingtai]] city of [[Hebei]] Province). The year 662 BC saw the State of Xing taken over by the [[Wei (Spring and Autumn Period)|State of Wei]], and the noble descendants entitled themselves their former state name as their surnames. 2. According to [[Xing Kao]] ([[:zh:姓考]]), or Surname Investigation, in the [[Spring and Autumn Period]], Dafu ([[:zh:大夫 (官名)|zh:大夫]]) Han Xuanzi of the [[Jin (Chinese state)|State of Jin]], along with his family and offsprings resided in Xing county (now east of Wen county of [[Henan]] Province), and later his descendants had the surname Xing after the county name. ==References== * [http://www.greatchinese.com/surname/195.htm Origination of Xing (邢)] * [[:zh:百家姓]] [[Category:Chinese-language surnames]] {{surname-stub}}
